alert.note: Alert for Mifflin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 7:50PM EST until January 10 at 5:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Centre, Huntingdon, Juniata and Mifflin. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - The heaviest rainfall is over for the central mountains, with just a few additional showers expected this evening. Those showers will be much lighter. Additional rainfall of a tenth of an inch or less is expected. Expect minor flooding. The larger creeks and rivers will be rising, but crests and impacts along them will take a few more hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... State College, Lewistown, Huntingdon, Bellefonte, Blanchard, Port Royal, Reedsville and Millheim. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
